author: Cathryn Essinger
title: My Dog Practices Geometry
text: every day I watch her using the yard’s big maple as the apex of a triangle

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: To Flush, My Dog
text: But of thee it shall be said, This dog watched beside a bed Day and night unweary, —

author: David Lehman
title: For I Will Consider Your Dog Molly
text: For she does not lie awake in the dark and weep for her sins, and whine about her condition, and discuss her duty to God.

author: Pablo Neruda
title: A Dog Has Died
text: all his sweet and shaggy life, always near me, never troubling me, and asking nothing.
